creator: ruben.laguna@gmail.com
text:
JMeterThread.rampUpDelay() will blindy wait its initialDelay without
periodically checking if the test was stopped. In test with long rampup periods,
(2 minutes) is annoying to wait the whole rampup perior just to stop the test.

creator: ruben.laguna@gmail.com
text:
Created attachment 19216
patch to check if the test is stopped during the rampup period

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
A good idea.

However I think the fixed 400ms wait (in the patch) should be a JMeter property 
with a longer default.

(In reply to comment #2)
> A good idea.
> 
> However I think the fixed 400ms wait (in the patch) should be a JMeter property 
> with a longer default.

Well yeah, anything below 5 secs should be ok, and if you make it a  config
property will be even better, of course.
